result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew E. Wilber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent
Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: each other and to any other probation sentence

miscConds.notes:
Probation may be transferred to country of residence (Outagamie).
50 days credit if revoked.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: each other and to any other probation sentence

Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 8:24 a.m. 
**Includes 14CF749, 14TR4091, 14TR4092 & 14TR4093**
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. Defendant appears in person, with Attorney Richard Lawson. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief filed.
State moves to DRI Ct.1- Take and Drive Vehicle without Consent, DRI Ct.2- Possess Drug Para. (Methamphetamine), DRI Ct.3- Possession of Methamphetamine, Dismiss 14TR4091 & Dismiss 14TR4092.
COURT GRANTS. 
PLEA:Ct.4- Possess Drug Para.>>GUILTY
          Ct.5- Possess Drug Para.>>GUILTY
14TR4093- Hit & Run>>GUILTY
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made: a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: Ct.4 & Ct.5 SWH- 1 year probation concurrent to each other and to any other probation sentence. Probation may be transferred to county of residence (Outagamie) CONDITIONS: Absolute Sobriety, CC & DNA surcharge. Defendant is entitled 50 days credit if revoked. 
14TR4093- Fine of $263.50 to be paid within 60 days. 
Adj: 8:33 a.m.
from Atty Lawson
